column4: http://pastie.org/3717654 I get this when i try to run any java command via commandline. When I rightclick an application and use run with openjdk 6 it works.
you have two java packages installed. try running the other package's java command
probably your other install is corrupted, or just incompatible
try reinstalling it, then removing it again. looks like something is corrupted
When I did this, I got this error. http://pastie.org/3717783
looks like something is corrupted in your system. check your disk and memory modules
that, or the package itself is corrupted
fsck to check filesystem, memtest (from grub) to check memory
run aptitude update and then try reinstalling
